triples.name: Generative artificial intelligence
triples.relevance: The paper analyzes how generative AI tools can improve social science research across multiple applications.

triples.name: Natural language generation
triples.relevance: Text generation is explicitly mentioned as a capability of generative AI that can be applied to social science.

triples.name: Text-to-image model
triples.relevance: Image generation is mentioned as a key output of generative AI that influences research methodologies.

triples.name: Survey methodology
triples.relevance: The paper discusses how generative AI can improve survey research, a core social science methodology.

triples.name: Web-based experiments
triples.relevance: Online experiments are identified as a social science technique that could be enhanced by generative AI.

triples.name: Content analysis
triples.relevance: Automated content analysis is highlighted as a social science tool that could benefit from generative AI applications.

triples.name: Agent-based model
triples.relevance: Agent-based models are mentioned as a social science technique for studying human behavior that could be improved by AI.

triples.name: Algorithmic bias
triples.relevance: Bias in training data is discussed as a major limitation of generative AI that impacts social science research quality.

triples.name: Human behavior
triples.relevance: Understanding human behavior is the central research focus of social science that generative AI tools can address.

triples.name: Open-source software
triples.relevance: The paper proposes creating open-source infrastructure for social science research on human behavior to ensure broad access and progress.
